meanings.definition: In a manner that is contrary to reason or common sense.
meanings.sent1: She preposterously believed that pigs could fly.
meanings.sent2: He preposterously claimed that the earth is flat.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking tree was preposterously amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her suggestion to build a house on a cloud was preposterously unrealistic.
meanings.sent5: The notion of a fish riding a bicycle is preposterously absurd.

meanings.definition: To an absurd or ridiculous degree.
meanings.sent1: He preposterously exaggerated the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent2: She preposterously spent all her money on a single pair of shoes.
meanings.sent3: The cat preposterously tried to climb the tree upside down.
meanings.sent4: His appetite was preposterously huge, devouring everything in sight.
meanings.sent5: The crowd preposterously cheered for the losing team, ignoring the score.
